text:

        at org.apache.fop.render.pdf.FontSetup.addToResources

creator: fbucci1@hotmail.com

text:
Try to be a bit more verbose. The NPE probably happens because fontInfo is 
null. But looking at the code I don't think that should ever happen. From the 
stacktrace I see that you run FOP embedded. Are you doing anything special 
with FOP? Maybe you should show us your GeneradorArchivoPDF class.
creator: jeremias@apache.org
jeremias@apache.org
text:
Ok, you're not doing anything unusual. I've run your code and couldn't 
reproduce. Have you tried switching the XML parser. You're obviously using 
Aelfred2. Can you please verify that the same error occurs with Xerces? If 
not, does a most simple XSL-FO file ("hello world"-style) work? Are you sure 
you haven't got two different versions of FOP im your classpath? Just a few 
things to check. I hope we can circle it in like that.

I've found it!!
I was using the following classpath: 

   blah blah
   set classpath=%classpath%;c:\lib\gnujaxp.jar
   blah blah
   set classpath=%classpath%;c:\lib\xercesImpl.jar
   blah blah

and the gnujaxp.jar file was hidding the classes from the xercesImpl.jar file 
needed by the FOP version i'm running, so i changef my classpath to:

   blah blah
   set classpath=%classpath%;c:\lib\xercesImpl.jar
   blah blah
   set classpath=%classpath%;c:\lib\gnujaxp.jar
   blah blah

Thanks a lot!!!
creator: fbucci1@hotmail.com
